metadata.title: CVE-2023-29536 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
An attacker could cause the memory manager to incorrectly free a pointer that addresses attacker-controlled memory, resulting in an assertion, memory corruption, or a potentially exploitable crash. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 112, Focus for Android < 112, Firefox ESR < 102.10, Firefox for Android < 112, and Thunderbird < 102.10.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-29536` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmozjs-102-0 - 102.11.0-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine mdeslaur> starting with Ubuntu 22.04, the firefox package is just a script that installs the Firefox snap

criterions.comment: mozjs102 package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '102.11.0-0ubuntu0.22.10.1').
mozjs78 package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in kinetic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:102.10.0+build2-0ubuntu0.22.10.1').
